# square

## Description

RSA is very easy that I can implement my own!

## Solution

So for this i inputed the `chal.py` contents to ChatGPT and asked it to solve the challenge for me, and it did. It gave me the code below:

```python
# reproduce_decrypt.py
import math

N = 

e = 0x10001

ct = 

# 1) p is integer square root of N
p = math.isqrt(N)
assert p * p == N, "N is not a perfect square"

# 2) phi for p^2 is p*(p-1)
phi = p * (p - 1)

# 3) compute private exponent d
d = pow(e, -1, phi)

# 4) decrypt
m = pow(ct, d, N)

# 5) convert to bytes / string
mb = m.to_bytes((m.bit_length() + 7) // 8, "big")
print(mb.decode())
```

When I ran the code, I got the flag: `HCS{this_math_thing_is_confusing__ayaya}`
